Caption: Figure 7: Handle meshes with boundaries by treating boundaries as feature lines. (a) the direction field which is perpendicular to the boundaries (b) the unconstrained MSC which is not aligned with the boundaries. (c) some edges of the MSC are aligned with the boundaries by orientation and alignment control. (d) the final quadrangulation result.
Mention:
As shown in Figure 7 and Figure 8, we create a direction field which
is perpendicular or parallel to the boundaries in the nearby region,
and use the orientation control to ensure that some of the edges of
the MSC are parallel with the boundaries. The alignment control
finally snaps edges precisely to the boundaries. In Figure 8, we
also add size controls to make the wavelength compatible with the
alignment configuration (which will be discussed in section 5).
